content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the solution in Julia. The `replace` function is used to replace all spaces or hyphen with underscores. Also, `lowercase` method is applied to make sure that column name is in lower case format.

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), " " => "_", "-" => "_")
end
```

You can use this function like:

```julia
println(clean_column("My Column")) # Outputs: my_column
println(clean_column("my-column"))  # Outputs: my_column
println(clean_column("another column "))  # Outputs: another_column
```
